# 1. Company Overview (TKO) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

TKO Group Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: TKO) is a premium sports and entertainment company. TKO owns iconic properties including UFC, the world's premier mixed martial arts organization; WWE, the global leader in sports entertainment; and PBR, the world's premier bull riding organization. In September 2023, Endeavor Group Holdings, UFC, and WWE formed a new publicly traded company, TKO Group Holdings, Inc. The new entity went public on September 12, 2023 and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the symbol "TKO".

The company owns and manages sports and entertainment intellectual property; produces and licenses live events, programing, and long-form and short-form content, reality series, and other filmed entertainment on digital and linear channels and via pay-per-view; and offers UFC FIGHT PASS, a direct-to-consumer streaming product that provides access to live and video-on-demand events, as well as original content. It is also involved in the merchandising of video games, apparel, equipment, trading cards, memorabilia, digital goods, and toys. In addition, the company engages in the sponsorships and advertising business, which offers sale of in-venue and in-broadcast advertising assets, content product integration, and digital impressions.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of TKO is 200.13 USD — it has increased by 0.50% in the past 24 hours. Today TKO Group Holdings, Inc. has the market capitalization of ‪16.13 B‬, it has decreased by −1.83% over the last week. TKO Group Holdings, Inc. pays a Quarterly dividend of $0.78 which represents an annual dividend yield of 1.1%. TKO Group Holdings, Inc. EBITDA is ‪1.39 B‬ USD, and current EBITDA margin is 41.64%.

The stock's performance has been strong, with TKO stock has fallen by −1.14% compared to the previous week, the month change is a −4.51% fall, over the last year TKO Group Holdings, Inc. has showed a 38.28% increase.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

TKO operates through multiple core segments:

• **UFC Segment:** UFC and WWE continued to operate as separate divisions under TKO, with Dana White as CEO of the UFC. The UFC produces more than 40 live events annually and offers UFC FIGHT PASS streaming service.

• **WWE Segment:** Nick Khan serving as president of WWE post-merger. WWE provides sports entertainment content through television shows, live events, and premium live events like WrestleMania.

• **Professional Bull Riders (PBR):** In 2025, TKO announced plans to form a boxing promotion known as Zuffa Boxing and acquire other sports and entertainment assets from Endeavor as part of Endeavor's sale to Silver Lake Partners

• **IMG:** IMG is a leading global sports marketing agency servicing more than 200 rightsholders – including The R&A (The British Open), the All England Lawn Tennis Club (Wimbledon), and Major League Soccer (MLS) – across media rights, production, brand partnerships, digital content, and event management. It powers growth of revenues, fanbases and IP for more than 200 federations, associations, events, and teams, including the National Football League, English Premier League, International Olympic Committee, National Hockey League, Major League Soccer, ATP and WTA Tours, the AELTC (Wimbledon), Euroleague Basketball, CONMEBOL, DP World Tour, and The R&A, as well as UFC, WWE, and PBR.

• **On Location:** On Location is a leading provider of premium hospitality and live experiences for more than 1,200 sporting events, including all premier NFL events, FIFA World Cup 26™, and the Milano Cortina 2026 and Los Angeles 2028 Olympic Games.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Zuffa Boxing:** On June 23, 2025, Ring Magazine officially announced that TKO's boxing promotion (earlier announced in March 2025 in partnership with Turki Al-Sheikh and Sela) will be known as Zuffa Boxing. The new deal announced Monday, which pertains to the United States, Canada and Latin America, calls for 12 events in 2026.

**UFC Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (UFC BJJ):** On June 6, 2025, TKO announced the creation of UFC Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (UFC BJJ), a sister company to the UFC based on submission grappling. UFC BJJ was described by the UFC as "the world's new premier Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu live event series".

**Lucha Libre AAA Acquisition:** On April 19, 2025, it was announced that via WWE, TKO would acquire the Mexican lucha libre promotion Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide in a joint venture with Fillip, a Mexican sports and entertainment company. The sale is expected to close in the third quarter of 2025, with TKO holding a 51% controlling stake.

## 5. Growth Strategy

TKO's growth strategy focuses on several key areas:

• **Media Rights Expansion:** The company has secured landmark deals including The deal has an average annual value of $1.1 billion, the companies said. for UFC with Paramount and significant WWE deals with Netflix and ESPN.

• **International Expansion:** As of December 31, 2024, approximately 93% of UFC and WWE fans are from international markets. We see a significant opportunity to further monetize and grow in existing international markets through traditional distribution partnerships

• **Cross-Platform Synergies:** Emanuel stated that it would "bring together two leading pureplay sports and entertainment companies" and provide "significant operating synergies".

• **Partnership Revenue Growth:** In 2025, at UFC and WWE, we expect to achieve $450 million in high-margin partnership revenue and continue to work towards achieving our previously communicated target of $1 billion in total company partnership revenue by around 2030.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Key Media Partners:**
• Paramount (UFC rights through 2033)
• Netflix (WWE Raw - 10-year, $5 billion deal)
• ESPN (WWE Premium Live Events - 5-year, $1.6 billion deal)

**Major Sponsors:**
We continue to expand the categories and volume of our partnerships with major brands, such as Anheuser-Busch, IBM, Procter & Gamble, Monster Energy, Cuervo, DraftKings, Toyo Tires and Slim Jim.

**Recent Partnerships:**
TKO Group Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: TKO) and Polymarket, the world's largest prediction market, today announced a comprehensive multi-year partnership in which Polymarket will become the Official and Exclusive Prediction Market Partner of UFC and Zuffa Boxing.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:**
For the quarter ended September 2025, TKO Group Holdings (TKO) reported revenue of $1.12 billion, up 64.4% over the same period last year. EPS came in at $0.50, compared to $0.53 in the year-ago quarter.

**Segment Performance:**
Net Revenue- WWE: $402.1 million versus the four-analyst average estimate of $348.64 million. The reported number represents a year-over-year change of +23.2%.

Net Revenue- UFC: $325.2 million compared to the $342.4 million average estimate based on four analysts. The reported number represents a change of -8.4% year over year.

**2025 Guidance:** Based on outperformance through the first nine months of the year and our anticipated performance for the remainder of the year, the Company is raising its guidance and now expects full year 2025 revenue of $4.690 billion - $4.720 billion and Adjusted EBITDA of $1.570 billion - $1.580 billion.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
• Major multi-billion dollar media rights deals creating predictable revenue streams
• Cross-promotional opportunities between UFC and WWE
• Growing global appetite for live sports content
• Premium live events commanding strong site fees and sponsorships
• Streaming platforms paying premium for exclusive content

**Headwinds:**
• If competitors offer significantly higher purses, TKO must match or risk losing star power that drives pay-per-view buys and event gates. Talent is the raw material of the business, and cost inflation here directly hits margins.
• Legal settlements and ongoing litigation costs
• Integration challenges from recent acquisitions (IMG, On Location, PBR)
• Dependence on key personalities and talent retention
• Economic sensitivity affecting discretionary spending on live events

## 9. Market Shares

**Combat Sports Dominance:** As of 2024, the UFC and WWE were the two most valuable combat sports organizations in the world according to Forbes. UFC was listed as the most valued mixed martial arts (MMA) company with a revenue of $1.406 billion and WWE is the most valued professional wrestling promotion with a revenue of $1.398 billion in 2023.

**Market Position:** Both divisions dominate the media and sports entertainment market in 2024, with no significant competitors, essentially creating a monop

**Global Reach:** Together, these properties reach 1 billion households across 210 countries and territories and organize more than 500 live events year-round, attracting more than three million fans.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Direct UFC Competitors:**
• **Bellator MMA:** In Q2 2022, WWE reported a revenue of $328 million, while UFC held its events in a market where Bellator's revenue surpassed $50 million in the same year.
• **PFL (Professional Fighters League):** The PFL has gained traction with its unique season-format and substantial prize money. This format attracts both fighters and viewers, challenging UFC's market share.

**Direct WWE Competitors:**
• **All Elite Wrestling (AEW):** WWE's main direct competitor is All Elite Wrestling (AEW). AEW has established itself as a credible alternative, attracting a significant fanbase and securing national television deals.

**Broader Competition:** Major Sports Leagues: The NFL, NBA, MLB, and NHL command massive viewership and media rights, competing for the same audience.

TKO's competitive advantage lies in its unique position combining two dominant combat sports/entertainment brands with strong intellectual property rights and global distribution capabilities.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Completed Acquisitions (February 2025):**
On February 28, 2025, TKO Group Holdings, Inc. ("TKO") completed the acquisition of certain businesses operating under the IMG brand ("IMG"), On Location, and Professional Bull Riders ("PBR") (collectively referred to as the "Acquired Businesses").

**Strategic Partnerships:**
• On March 5, 2025, TKO announced a partnership with Turki Al-Sheikh, the chairman of the Saudi General Entertainment Authority, and Saudi entertainment conglomerate Sela to launch a new boxing promotion in 2026.

• UFC®, the world's premier mixed martial arts organization and part of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO), together with Anheuser-Busch, one of America's most iconic companies and the undisputed leader of the U.S. beer industry, today announced a new multiyear marketing partnership. Effective January 1, 2024, the brewer will become the exclusive "Official Beer Partner of UFC."

## 12. Recent Developments

**Major Media Rights Deals:**
• **UFC-Paramount Deal:** Paramount will become the new home to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S. under a seven-year agreement with TKO Group announced Monday. The deal has an average annual value of $1.1 billion, the companies said.

• **WWE-Netflix Deal:** Netflix (NYSE: NFLX) and WWE®, part of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO) today announced that the debut episode of RAW on Netflix got off to a strong start, with the Monday night program capturing 4.9M Live+1 views* globally. The inaugural event on Netflix averaged 2.6 million households (Live+SD) in the US, according to VideoAmp, which is 116% higher than RAW's average 2024 US audience of 1.2 million households, and higher than any other Monday Night RAW broadcast in the past five years.

**Capital Returns:** TKO announced increased capital returns, including a 100% increase in their dividend and a $1bn increase in their term loan to initiate additional share repurchases.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Analyst Consensus:** The 16 analysts that cover TKO Group stock have a consensus rating of "Strong Buy" and an average price target of $213.69, which forecasts a 13.42% increase in the stock price over the next year. TKO average Analyst price target in the past 3 months is 222.27.

**Valuation Concerns:** Based on the preferred valuation multiple, TKO Group Holdings is trading at a Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio of 72.5 times. This is significantly higher than both the U.S. Entertainment industry average of 37.9x and the estimated fair P/E ratio of 31.9x. These figures suggest that the stock is currently overvalued compared to its peers and broader sector benchmarks.

**Investment Strengths:**
• Secured multiple billion-dollar media rights deals providing revenue visibility
• Dominant market positions in combat sports entertainment
• Strong cash flow generation and margin profile
• Growing international expansion opportunities
• Diversified revenue streams from live events, media rights, sponsorships, and merchandise

**Investment Risks:**
• High valuation multiples leave little room for execution disappointment
• Talent cost inflation pressures
• Integration challenges from recent acquisitions
• Economic sensitivity to discretionary spending

**Buy Rating: 7.8/10**

**Estimated Fair Value: $185-195**

The company demonstrates strong fundamentals with landmark media deals creating substantial revenue visibility through 2030+. However, the current valuation at 72.5x P/E appears stretched relative to peers. The stock offers strong growth potential for investors with moderate risk appetite, particularly on any pullbacks toward the $185-195 range where risk-adjusted returns become more attractive. The combination of UFC and WWE creates a unique entertainment portfolio with significant barriers to entry and global monetization opportunities.
tldr_summary:
TKO Group Holdings is a sports and entertainment company owning iconic properties including UFC, WWE, and PBR, creating content across live events, media rights, and digital platforms. 

The company's strength lies in its dominant market position in combat sports, with recent landmark media rights deals from Paramount (UFC) and Netflix (WWE) providing substantial revenue visibility through 2030. TKO's growth strategy focuses on international expansion, cross-platform synergies, and leveraging its unique intellectual property across multiple entertainment verticals. Key differentiators include global reach (1 billion households across 210 countries), diversified revenue streams, and minimal direct competition in combat sports entertainment. Recent strategic moves like launching Zuffa Boxing and acquiring Lucha Libre AAA demonstrate aggressive expansion plans.

With a strong buy rating of 7.8/10 and estimated fair value of $185-$195, the stock offers compelling growth potential despite current high valuation multiples, recommended for investors with moderate risk tolerance seeking exposure to global sports entertainment.
